Notifications API Reference

Each ServiceStack Route will be listed with it's Return Type, which Verbs (aka Methods) are allowed to be used with it, the url path for the endpoint, notes entered by the developer in the code, a summary of the purpose of the endpoint, the data that the endpoint can take in (parameters) as well as the Return Type's properties (if an object model) and an example of how to call it in TypeScript.

SendReceiptNotificationWithEmail
POST | Returns: CEFActionResponse | Path: /Notifications/ReceiptNotificationWithEmail

Use to update a specific sales order item

Takes in the following parameters

Name Data Type Parameter Type Required Description
OrderID int body Yes Order ID
Email string body Yes Email address to send the notification to

TypeScript Example

var dto = <api.SendReceiptNotificationWithEmailDto>{
	OrderID: this.someValue1, // number
	Email: this.someValue2, // string
};
this.cvApi.notifications.SendReceiptNotificationWithEmail(dto).then(r => {
	if (!r || !r.data) {
		// Error State
		return;
	}
	this.something = r.data;
}).catch(reason => console.error(reason));

SendReturnShippedNotification
POST | Returns: CEFActionResponse<EmailQueueModel> | Path: /Notifications/ReturnShippedNotification/{ID}

No Summary! Please ask a Dev to add a Summary value to the [Route] attribute!

Takes in the following parameters

Name Data Type Parameter Type Required Description
ID int path Yes The identifier for the record to call.

TypeScript Example

var id: number = this.someValue1;
this.cvApi.notifications.SendReturnShippedNotification(id).then(r => {
	if (!r || !r.data) {
		// Error State
		return;
	}
	this.something = r.data;
}).catch(reason => console.error(reason));
